YEAST.NAME: Abbey IV Ale Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Medium fruit flavors for Belgian styles.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Trappist Belgian Ales, Dubbels, Tripels and Specialty ales

YEAST.NAME: American Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Dry, clean, and versitile.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American Pale Ale, Scottish Ale, Porters, Sweet Stout, Barleywine

YEAST.NAME: American Ale II
YEAST.NOTES: Clean, slightly nutty, tart finish.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: All American Ales, Brown Ales, Barleywine

YEAST.NAME: American Ale Yeast Blend
YEAST.NOTES: Clean, with a lager-like finish. Sulfur notes.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American ales with clean finish

YEAST.NAME: American Farmhouse Blend
YEAST.NOTES: Complex, moderate sourness from brettanomyces.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Saisons, Farmhouse Ales

YEAST.NAME: American Hefeweizen Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Slight clove, banana flavor with some sulfur. Contributes haze.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Oregon style American Hefeweizen

YEAST.NAME: American Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Complex and aromatic.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American Lagers and Pilsners

YEAST.NAME: American Lager Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Dry and clean with very slight apple fruitiness.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American style Lagers

YEAST.NAME: American Wheat Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Dry, crisp, and slightly tart. Low esters.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American Wheat, Berliner Weiss, Hefeweizen

YEAST.NAME: Antwerp Ale Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Biscuity, ale-like aroma with lager-like flavor. Accentuates hop flavors and bitterness.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian pale and amber ales

YEAST.NAME: Australian Ale Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Clean and bready. Can ferment clean at high temperatures.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Australian Ales, English Ales

YEAST.NAME: Bastogne Belgian Ale
YEAST.NOTES: High gravity Trappist ale yeast. Dry, slightly acidic finish. Cleaner and less spicy than WLP500 or WLP530.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: High gravity beers, Belgian ales, Dubbels, Trippels.

YEAST.NAME: Bavarian Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Full-bodied, rich, malty.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: German Bocks, Vienna, Oktoberfest, Hells, Marzens, Dunkel

YEAST.NAME: Bavarian Weizen Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Moderate spicy, phenolic overtones reminiscent of cloves.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bavarian Weizen and wheat beers.

YEAST.NAME: Bavarian Wheat
YEAST.NOTES: Bubblegum and banana flavors, with apple/plum ester profile.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bavarian Weizen, Hefeweizen

YEAST.NAME: Bavarian Wheat Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Mild ester and phenolic profile.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bavarian style wheat beers.

YEAST.NAME: Bedford British Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Ferments dry. Distinctive ester profile.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: English style ales - bitter, pale, porter and brown ale

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Abbey II
YEAST.NOTES: Dry, with slight fruitiness. High alcohol tolerance.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Ales, Trappist Ales, Abbey Ales, Grand Cru

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Complex phenolic, spicy profile.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Ales, Saisons, Belgian Reds, Belgian Browns, White beers

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Ale Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Alcohol tolerant. Slightly spicy, well attenuated.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Ales, Abbey Ales, Trappist Ales

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Ardennes
YEAST.NOTES: Mild fruitiness and complex spicy flavor, phenolic at high temperatures.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Ale

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Golden Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Fruity and phenolic.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Ales, Dubbels

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Lager Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Clean, crisp, European lager yeast.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: European style pilsners, dark lagers, Vienna lager, and American style lagers

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Lambic Blend
YEAST.NOTES: Lambic mixture of yeasts and bacterias creates lactic flavor.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Lambic

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Saison
YEAST.NOTES: Bubblegum, with spicy aromatics. Tart, dry, and crisp.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Saison beer

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Saison I Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Earthy, spicy, peppery and slightly sweet.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Saison Ale, Belgian Ale, Dubbel, Trippel

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Saison II Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Fruity ester profile. Moderately phenolic with a clove-like flavor and aroma.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian or French Saison

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Sour Mix 1
YEAST.NOTES: Blend of Brettanomyces, Saccharomyces, Lactobacillus and Pediococcus. Use in secondary.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian sour beers

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Strong Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Dry, tart, fruity flavor. High alcohol tolerance.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Ales, Scottish Strong Ale,Trappist Ales, Dubbels, Trippels

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Strong Ale Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Moderate esters, spicy phenolic character. Balanced finish.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian dark strongs, Abbey ales and Christmas beers

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Style Ale Yeast Blend
YEAST.NOTES: Versatile blend to be used for Trappist and other Belgian style ales.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Trappist and other Belgian ales.

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Style Saison Ale Yeast Blend
YEAST.NOTES: Complex, fruity aromas and flavors. Phenolic, spicy, earthy, and clove like flavor
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian and French Saison

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Wheat Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Plum and apple aroma with a dry finish.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Wheat, Bavarian Weizen

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Wit Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Phenolic and tart.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Wit

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Wit II
YEAST.NOTES: Mildly phenolic, quite spicy.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Wit, Spiced Ale, Wheat Ales and Specialty Beers

YEAST.NAME: Belgian Witbier
YEAST.NOTES: Tart, slightly phenolic character. High alcohol tolerance.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Wit, Grand Cru

YEAST.NAME: Berliner Weisse Blend
YEAST.NOTES: Subtle tartness. Can take several months to develop character.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Berliner Weisse

YEAST.NAME: Bohemian Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Ferments clean. Rich malty flavor comes through.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bohemian Pilsners, Pilsners, German Helles, Bocks

YEAST.NAME: Brettanomyces Bruxellensis
YEAST.NOTES: Medium intensity Brett character. Takes months to develop fully.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian sour ales and labics (in secondary)

YEAST.NAME: Brettanomyces Bruxellensis
YEAST.NOTES: Horse hair and sour cherry-pie flavor. Takes months to develop fully.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Lambic, Gueze Lambic, and Sour Browns

YEAST.NAME: Brettanomyces Claussenii
YEAST.NOTES: Low intensity Brett character. Pineapple like aroma. Mild flavor contribution.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Sour ales (in secondary)

YEAST.NAME: Brettanomyces Lambicus
YEAST.NOTES: High intensity Brett character. Horsey, smoky and spicy flavors.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Lambics and Flanders/Sour Brown ales

YEAST.NAME: Brettanomyces Lambicus
YEAST.NOTES: Cherry-pie like flavor and sourness. Works best in conjunction with other yeast.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Lambic

YEAST.NAME: British Ale
YEAST.NOTES: High attenuation, allows malt character to come through.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Excellent for all English style ales including bitters, pale ale, porters and brown ale.

YEAST.NAME: British Ale II
YEAST.NOTES: Malty, clean, crisp finish. Dry flavor.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: British and Canadian Ales, English Bitters

YEAST.NAME: British Ale Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Fruity, and tart. Dry, crisp finish.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: All British Ales, Pales, Bitters, English Strong Ale

YEAST.NAME: British Cask Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Nice malt profile with a hint of fruit. Finishes dry and slightly tart.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: British Ales

YEAST.NAME: Budvar Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Malty and subtle fruit aroma. Dry crisp finish.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bohemian Pilsner, Classic Pilsners, Dortmunder and Light Lagers

YEAST.NAME: Burton Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Complex flavor blend of apple, pear, and clover honey.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: All English styles including Pale Ale, IPA, Porter, Stout and Bitters.

YEAST.NAME: Cabernet Red Wine Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Excellent for full-bodied red wines, ester production complements flavor. Alcohol Tolerance: 16%
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Merlot, Chardonnay, Chianti, Chenin Blanc, and Sauvignon Blanc

YEAST.NAME: California Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Accentuates hop flavor. Clean flavor and finish. Versatile.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American Style Ales, Ambers, Pale Ales, Brown Ale, Strong Ale

YEAST.NAME: California Ale V
YEAST.NOTES: Clean flavor and finish. Versatile. Produces a full bodied beer.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American style Pales, Ambers, Browns, IPAs, American Strong Ale

YEAST.NAME: California Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Lagers at high temperature and produces malty, clear beers.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: California Common

YEAST.NAME: Champagne Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Can tolerate alcohol up to 17%. For Barley Wine or Meads.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Wine, Mead and Cider

YEAST.NAME: Chardonnay White Wine Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Dry. Mild esters, low sulfur dioxide production. Fermentation speed is moderate.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Chardonnay Wine

YEAST.NAME: Cream Ale Yeast Blend
YEAST.NOTES: Creates a clean, light lager style ale. An estery aroma may be present.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Cream Ale, Hybrids

YEAST.NAME: Czech Pilsner Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Dry but malty finish. Some sulfur produced, but will diminish over time.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bohemian and American Pilsner, Bocks, Oktoberfest, Marzen

YEAST.NAME: Danish Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Rich flavor with a crisp, dry finish. Accentuates hop flavor.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Dortmund/Export Lagers

YEAST.NAME: Dry English Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Clean, Highly flocculant, and highly attentive yeast. Similar to White labs English Ale yeast, but more attentive. Suitable for high gravity ales.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Pale Ales, Amber, ESB, Brown Ales, Strong Ales

YEAST.NAME: Dusseldorf Alt Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Traditional Alt yeast from Dusseldorf, Germany. Produces clean, slightly sweet alt beers. Does not accentuate hop flavor like WLP029 does.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Alt biers, Dusseldorf Alts, German Ales

YEAST.NAME: East Coast Ale
YEAST.NOTES: White labs "Brewer Patriot" strain can be used to reproduce many of the American versions of classic beer styles. Very clean with low esters.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American Ales, Golden ales, Blonde Ale, Pale Ale and German Alt styles

YEAST.NAME: Edinburgh Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Malty strong ale yeast. Reproduces complex, malty, flavorful schottish ales. Hop character comes through well.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Strong Scottish style ales, ESB, Irish Reds

YEAST.NAME: English Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Classic ESB strain best for English style milds, bitters, porters and English style stouts. Leaves a clear beer with some residual sweetness.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: English Pale Ale, ESB, India Pale Ale, Brown Ale, Porter, Sweet Stouts and Strong Ales

YEAST.NAME: English Cider Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Classic Cider yeast. Ferments dry, but retains apple flavor. Some sulfer produced during fermentation will fade with age.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Cider, Wine and High Gravity Beer

YEAST.NAME: Essex Ale Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Flavorful British yeast with a drier finish than many ale yeasts. Bready and fruity in character. Well suited for top cropping (collecting). Does not flocculate as much as WLP005 or WLP002.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: British milds, pale ales, bitters, stouts.

YEAST.NAME: European Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Malty, Northern European ale yeast. Low ester production, low sulfer, gives a clean profile. Low attenuation contributes to malty taste.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Alt, Kolsch, malty English Ales, Fruit beers

YEAST.NAME: European Ale Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Very malty flavor characteristic of Bavarian/Munich Ales. Complex character.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: European Ales, German Ales, Alts, Pale Ale, Brown Ale, Kolsch

YEAST.NAME: European Lager II
YEAST.NOTES: Clean, dry flavor profile for aggressively hopped pilsners. Dry finish, mild aroma, slight sulfur production.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bohemian Pilsner, American Pilsner, Helles, Dunkel

YEAST.NAME: Flor Sherry Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: This yeast develops a film (flor) on the surface of the wine. Creates green almond, granny smith and nougat characteristics found in sherry. Can also be used for Port, Madeira and other sweet styles. For use in secondary fermentation. Slow fermentor. Al
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Sherry wine yeast

YEAST.NAME: Forbidden Fruit
YEAST.NOTES: Phenolic profile with subdued fruitiness. Available seasonally.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Wit, Grand Cru

YEAST.NAME: French Red Wine Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Classic Bordeaux yeast for red wine fermentations. Moderate fermentation characteristics. Tolerates lower fermentation temperatures. Rich, smooth flavor profile. Alcohol Tolerance: 17%
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bordeaux

YEAST.NAME: French Saison
YEAST.NOTES: A very versatile strain that produces Saison or farmhouse style biers as well as other Belgian style beers that are highly aromatic (estery), peppery, spicy and citrusy. This strain enhances the use of spices and aroma hops, and is extremely attenuative b
YEAST.BEST_FOR: French and Belgian Saison or Farmhouse ales

YEAST.NAME: French White Wine Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Classic yeast for white wine fermentation. Slow to moderate fermenter and foam producer. Gives an enhanced creamy texture. Alcohol Tolerance: 16%
YEAST.BEST_FOR: French white wines

YEAST.NAME: GF All American Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Popular all purpose American ale style now in a Gluten Free strain. Produces beers that are nutty, clean with a slight tart finish. Ferment warmer to accentuate hops and add fruitiness or ferment cold for clean light citrus character.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American Amber, Brown, IPA, Pale ales and stouts. Blondes and fruit beers.

YEAST.NAME: German Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Crisp, dry finish with a mild flavor.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: German Ales, Alts, Kolsch, Dry Stout

YEAST.NAME: German Ale II
YEAST.NOTES: Strong sulfer component will reduce with aging. Clean flavor, but with more ester production than regular German Ale Yeast.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Kolsch, Alt and German Pale Ales

YEAST.NAME: German Ale/Kolsch
YEAST.NOTES: Great for light beers. Accentuates hop flavors. Slight sulfer flavor will fade with age and leave a clean, lager like ale.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Kolsch, Altbiers, Pale Ales, Blonde and Honey Ales

YEAST.NAME: German Bock Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Produces beer that has balanced malt and hop character.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bocks, Doppelbocks, Oktoberfest, Vienna, Helles, some American Pilsners

YEAST.NAME: German Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Very malty and clean.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: German Marzen, Pilsner, Lagers, Oktoberfest beers.

YEAST.NAME: German Wheat
YEAST.NOTES: Subtle flavor profile. Sharp, fruity, crisp, sherry like flavor.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bavarian Weizen

YEAST.NAME: Hefeweizen Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Banana and clove aroma. Produces cloudy appearance.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: German style wheat beers. Weiss, Weizen, Hefeweizen

YEAST.NAME: Hefeweizen IV Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Large clove and phenolic aroma, but with minimal banana flavor. Citrus and apricot notes. Crisp and drinkable, with some sulfur production.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: German style Hefeweizen

YEAST.NAME: Irish Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Dry diacetyl, fruity flavor characteristic of stouts. Full bodied, dry, clean flavor.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Irish Dry Stouts, Porter, Scottish Ale, Brown Ale, Imperial Stout, Barley Wine

YEAST.NAME: Irish Ale Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Excellent for Irish Stouts. Produces slight hint of diacetyl balanced by a light fruitiness and a slightly dry crispness.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Irish Ales, Stouts, Porters, Browns, Reds and Pale Ale

YEAST.NAME: Klassic Ale Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Traditional English Ale style yeast. Produces ester character, and allows hop flavor through. Leaves a slightly sweet malt character in ales.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bitters, milds, porters stouts and scottish ale styles.

YEAST.NAME: Kolsch Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Very malty flavor with mix of lager and ale character. Crisp, clean finish.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Kolsch, European Ales

YEAST.NAME: Lactobacillus
YEAST.NOTES: Lactic acid bacteria isolated from a Belgian brewery. This culture produces moderate levels of acidity and is commonly found in many types of beers including gueuze, lambics, sour brown ales and Berliner Weisse. It is always used in conjunction with S.cer
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian sout beers (secondary)

YEAST.NAME: Lactobacillus Bacteria
YEAST.NOTES: Bacteria for use in secondary. This lactic acid bacteria produces moderate levels of acidity and sour flavors found in lambics, Berliner Weiss, sour brown ale and gueze.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Lambic, Berliner Weiss, Sour Brown and Gueze (secondary)

YEAST.NAME: Lactobacillus Delbrueckii
YEAST.NOTES: Lactic acid bacteria isolated from Belgium. Produces mild acidity and sourness found in many types of Belgian beers. Always used in conjunction with S. Cerevisiae and wild yeasts.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian gueze, lambic, sour brown ales, and Berliner Weisse.

YEAST.NAME: London Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Dry, malty ale yeast. Produces a complex, oak flavored ester character. Hop bitterness comes through well.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Classic British Pale Ales, Bitters and Stouts

YEAST.NAME: London Ale III
YEAST.NOTES: Light, fruity flavor. Balanced flavor with hint of sweetness.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: British Ales, Bitters

YEAST.NAME: London Ale Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Dry finish, bold, rich flavor, some fruit profile and a crisp finish.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: English Ales, Bitters, IPAs, Brown Ale

YEAST.NAME: London ESB Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Malty, balanced flavor. Fruity, rich finish. Excellent for cask conditioned ales and bitters.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: English Bitters, IPA, Brown Ales, Mild Ales

YEAST.NAME: Malolactic Bacteria
YEAST.NOTES: Bacteria for use in secondary. Malolactic fermentation is the conversion of malic acid to lactic acid by bacteria from the lactic acid bacteria family. Lactic acid is less acidic than malic acid, which in turn decreases acidity and helps to soften and/o
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Primarily wine

YEAST.NAME: Manchester Ale Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Top fermenting strain that is good for top-cropping. Moderately flocculent with a clean, dry finish. Low ester profile for producing a balanced English ale.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: English style ales

YEAST.NAME: Merlot Red Wine Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Neutral, low fusel alcohol production. Will ferment to dryness, alcohol tolerance to 18%. Vigorous fermenter. WLP740 is well suited for Merlot, Shiraz, Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Cabernet, Sauvignon Blanc, and Semillon. Alcohol Tolerance: 18%
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Merlot, Shiraz, Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Cabernet, Sauvignon Blanc, and Semillon

YEAST.NAME: Mexican Lager
YEAST.NOTES: From Mexico City - produces a clean lager beer with a crisp finish. Good for mexican style beers.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Mexican style light and dark lagers.

YEAST.NAME: Munich Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Unique Pilsner strain. Very smooth, well-rounded and full bodied. Benefits from a diacetyl rest.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Pilsners, Light Lagers, Dortmond/Export, Marzen/Oktoberfest, Dunkel

YEAST.NAME: North American Lager
YEAST.NOTES: American and Canadian lager yeast. Malty finish makes it suitable for Marzens/Oktoberfest as well.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American Pilsner, California Common, Canadian Lager, Oktoberfest, Marzen

YEAST.NAME: Northwest Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Classic Northwest US ale yeast. Slight fruit flavor, malty ale with good body and balance.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Oregon Ales, All American Ale styles

YEAST.NAME: Nottingham Ale Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: British style of ale yeast with a very dry finish and high attenuation. Medium to low fruit and fusel alcohol production. Good top fermenting yeast for cropping.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: British ales, pale ales, ambers, porters and stouts.

YEAST.NAME: Octoberfest Lager Blend
YEAST.NOTES: This blend of lager strains is designed to produce a rich, malty, complex and full bodied Octoberfest style beer. It attenuates well while leaving plenty of malt character and mouthfeel. This strain is low in sulfur production.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Octoberfest, Marzen, Bavarian lagers

YEAST.NAME: Octoberfest/Marzen Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Produces a malty, bock style beer. Does not finish as dry or as fast as White's German Lager yeast. Longer lagering or starter recommended.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Marzen, Oktoberfest, European Lagers, Bocks, Munich Helles

YEAST.NAME: Old Bavarian Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Southern Germany/Bavarian lager yeast. Finishes malty with a slight ester profile.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Oktoberfest, Marzen, Bock and Dark Lagers.

YEAST.NAME: Pacific Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Popular yeast from the Pacific Northwest. Leaves a clear and malty profile. More fruity than WLP002. Suitable for many English and American styles.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: English & American ales including milds, bitters, IPA, porters and English stouts.

YEAST.NAME: Pediococcus
YEAST.NOTES: Lactic acid bacteria used in the production of Belgian style beers where additional acidity is desirable. Often found in gueuze and other Belgian style beer. Acid production will increase with storage time. It may also cause ropiness and produce low level
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian sour ales

YEAST.NAME: Pediococcus Cerevisiae
YEAST.NOTES: Lactic acid bacteria isolated from Belgium. Creates a high level of lactic acidity over a long time. Often used with other yeasts, and it may take several months for flavor to fully develop.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Gueze and other Belgian styles.

YEAST.NAME: Pilsen Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Classic American pilsner strain. Smooth with a malty flavor. Dry and crisp fermentation.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American Pilsner, Bohemian Pilsner, Light Lagers

YEAST.NAME: Pilsner Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Classic pilsner strain from Czech Republic. Dry with a malty finish.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: European Pilsners, Bohemian Pilsner

YEAST.NAME: Premium Bitter Ale
YEAST.NOTES: From Staffordshire England. Mild, but complex estery flavor. High attenuation - ferments strong and dry. Suitable for high gravity beers.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: All English ales including bitters, milds, ESB, Porter, Stout and Barley Wine

YEAST.NAME: Ringwood Ale
YEAST.NOTES: European ale yeast. Highly flocculant with complex, clear, but malty profile. Slightly fruity ester.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Ringwood Ale, Brown Ales

YEAST.NAME: Roselare Belgian Blend
YEAST.NOTES: Culture of Saccharomyces, Brettonomyces and Lactic Acid Bacteria. Complex aromas and flavors. May be used for primary fermentation. Primarily for sour brown and red Belgian styles.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian sour brown and red beers.

YEAST.NAME: Sake Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: For use in rice based fermentations. For sake, use this yeast in conjunction with Koji (to produce fermentable sugar). WLP705 produces full body sake character, and subtle fragrance. Alcohol tolerance to 16%.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Sake wine yeast

YEAST.NAME: San Francisco Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Produces "California Common" style beer.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: California and Premium Lagers, all American Lagers

YEAST.NAME: Scottish Ale
YEAST.NOTES: High alcohol tolerance.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Scottish Ale, Scottish Strong Ales, Sweet Stout, Imperial Stout, Barley Wine

YEAST.NAME: Southern German Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Malty finish and balanced aroma. Strong fermenter, slight sulfur and low diacetyl.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: German Pilsner, Helles, Oktoberfest, Marzen, Bocks

YEAST.NAME: Southwold Ale
YEAST.NOTES: From Suffolk county. Products complex fruity and citrus flavors. Slight sulfer production, but this will fade with ageing.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: British bitters and pale ales.

YEAST.NAME: Steinberg-Geisenheim Wine
YEAST.NOTES: German origin wine yeast. High fruit/ester production. Moderate fermentation characteristics and cold tolerant.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Riesling wines.

YEAST.NAME: Super High Gravity Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Ferments up to 25% alcohol content. Flavor may vary greatly depending on beer alcohol. English like esters at low gravity, but will become more wine-like as alcohol exceeds 16% ABV. Refer to White Labs web page for tips on fermenting high gravity ales.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Very high gravity beers and barley wine up to 25% alcohol.

YEAST.NAME: Suremain Burgundy Wine Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: Emphasizes fruit aromas in barrel fermentations. High nutrient requirement to avoid volatile acidity production. Alcohol Tolerance: 16%
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Burgundy

YEAST.NAME: Sweet Mead/Wine
YEAST.NOTES: Lower attenuation than White Labs Champagne Yeast. Leaves some residual sweetness as well as fruity flavor. Alcohol concentration up to 15%.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Sweet Mead, Wine and Cider

YEAST.NAME: Thames Valley Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Clean, complex flavor. Low in fruit, low in esters, rich in flavor. Hops come through well.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: British Bitters, ESB, India Pale Ale, English Strong Ale

YEAST.NAME: Trappist Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Distinctive fruitiness and plum characteristics. Excellent for high gravity beers.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Trappist Ale, Dubbel, Trippel, Belgian Ales

YEAST.NAME: Trappist High Gravity
YEAST.NOTES: Robust top cropping yeast. Phenolic character and alcohol tolerance up to 12%. Rich ester profile and malty flavor.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Belgian Wit, Trappist Ale, High gravity ales

YEAST.NAME: Urquell Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Pilsner Urquell yeast with mild fruit/floral aroma. Very dry and clean on palate with full mouth feel. Subtle malt character. Clean and neutral finish.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bohemian Pilsner

YEAST.NAME: Weihenstephan Weizen
YEAST.NOTES: Unique Bavarian wheat yeast that produces the spicy weizen clove and banana flavor. Best when fermented at around 68 deg F.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Bavarian Weizen

YEAST.NAME: Whitbread Ale
YEAST.NOTES: Slightly more fruity and malty than Wyeast's British Ale. Clear and highly flocculant.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Whitbread Ale, British Ales, Pales, Bitters

YEAST.NAME: Wyeast Ale Blend
YEAST.NOTES: Blend of ale strains designed to provide quick starts, good flavor, balance and flocculation. Balanced finish suitable for most American and British ale styles.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: American and British Ale Styles.

YEAST.NAME: Wyeast Lager Blend
YEAST.NOTES: Blend of lager strains to produce a complex but clean lager flavor profile. Suitable for many common lager styles.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Classic Pilsners, Lagers, Bocks.

YEAST.NAME: Yorkshire Square Ale Yeast
YEAST.NOTES: This yeast produces a malty but well balanced profile. Expect toasty flavors with malt driven esters. Highly flocculent and a good choice for many English ales.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: English pale ales, English brown ales and Mild ales

YEAST.NAME: Zurich Lager
YEAST.NOTES: Swiss style lager yeast. Sulfer and diacytl production is minimal. May be used for high gravity lagers with proper care.
YEAST.BEST_FOR: Swiss style lager, and high gravity lagers (over 11% ABV)
